name: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine
Reason: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine is a compound with multiple functional groups that can influence its melting point. The basic unit we can compare to is benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 122.4 °C. The additional functional groups and structural features in this compound will affect its melting point: (1) The 1-naphthoyl group (c2cccc3c2cccc3) adds a large aromatic system, which could increase the melting point by about +20 due to increased pi-stacking interactions; (2) The 3-methoxybenzoyl group (COc1cccc(c1)C(=O)) includes a methoxy group (OCH3) that can increase the melting point by about +5 due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds and increased molecular weight; (3) The hydrazine group (NNC(=O)) can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
